Instructions: Change the input with the buttons in the top right.
Algorithm: Build up the tree at startup. The expected value, is then computed in a classical recursive way, each node calling the getValues() of its chimdren before computing its own.
However, only one new value is computed each way, so the recursion is slightly altered to stop once a new value has been set.
Part 2 is faster than part 1 because we don't need to know the value of each node, but only the ones that are required by their parent.
Display: Each node is displayed with its value in parentheses (if it has been computed).
